txt.en: 'Are all Orcs so worthless?'
'He is unarmed! You outnumber him by the dozen!'
'And still he humiliates you.'
'He is mine, Barkh. You are not to touch him.'
'Why should you listen to Gun Ain?'
'Because there are none deadlier than she!'
'This Ranger will die only at the hands of Gun Ain.'
'Is that understood?'

'The Wizard wants to see you, Ranger. This could be your last day of life, and my last day without a name!\n\n'What a fortunate day this is, if that be so! Your freedom from this life would be my release from shame. Both of us would rejoice, would we not?'
'We are here. Will the Wizard share his mind with his poor servant and his unworthy captive?'

'You're mine again today, little Ranger. And this time you will do as I say, won't you? You remember what happened the last time you refused to do your chores, don't you? Spent some time in the dungeons learning the meaning of pain, you did.\n\n'So this time will be different! Scoop some slop from that bucket and serve it to the boys!'
Barkh wants you to scoop some slop, but you have a better idea
'Gun Ain, stop him!' the Wizard screams!
'Gun Ain, stop him!' the Wizard screams!
Lothrandir of the Dúnedain still stands strong in the dungeons beneath Isengard, resisting the torments of his captors.
'Scoop some slop out of that barrel over there, little Ranger.'
'Did you not hear me, maggot? Use this one or it will go badly for you!'
'Argh!'
'If you spill this one I will have your head!'
'Lothrandir.'
'Now you die, worm!'
Talk to Barkh and receive your orders
'The Prince of Rohan is dead. The King is weak and cannot save his people.'
'To me, boys! Whoever lands the killing blow gets a helping of Ranger for supper!'
Tip over the slop bucket
'Why do you still resist?'
Barkh is not pleased with you
'Your friend escaped, but there is no escape for you.'
Tip over the other slop bucket
'Even now my forces move upon Rohan from the west and from the north.'
Survive the consequences of your defiance
'There is no hope for you, unless you swear loyalty to me.'
Talk to Gun Ain in the kitchens below Isengard
'For my captive there is only death. But for my friend... you could yet live.'
Talk to Gun Ain atop Orthanc
'What say you, Lothrandir of the Dúnedain?'
Keep Saruman from dominating your mind
'So be it. You will see things my way, in time.'
You have been told to report to Barkh in the kitchens for the day's orders.
'Why should I listen to you, outsider?'
Barkh wants you to serve some slop to the hungry uruks, but you have a better idea.
Barkh is not pleased with your defiance.
Barkh has asked you one more time to comply with his orders.
You have showed your defiance yet again, and the Uruks are not pleased!
Gun Ain has come to the kitchens underneath Isengard to bring you before Saruman.
You have come with Gun Ain to the tower of Orthanc, there to speak with Saruman.
You have been brought before the Wizard Saruman.
Interlude: Strength of Will
